history.content: I withdrawed last semester and it is basically a formality for readmission. There are links by berkeley saying that basically you can get back in as long as you email your advisor when you are enrolling again. Make sure not to miss the deadline for readmission. Readmission is basically? guaranteed and the difference between withdrawing and canceling is just about financial aid and when exactly you stop going to school. There aren't really any differences except that canceling might messup some things with aid and enrollments, but I am not clear on that. You can enroll in the summer after withdrawing, but I don't know about the deadlines then.

I am planning on interning next semester, and I was wondering what is the difference between withdrawing and cancelling? From what I read, withdrawing seems to be when you submit the form after the semester started, whereas cancelling is before. Beyond that, are there any differences between the two? Also, is readmission basically guaranteed if I am in good academic standing? Also, if I am to withdraw for the spring semester, am I able to reenroll to take classes during the summer or can I only reenroll for Fall 2021?
history.subject: What is the difference between withdrawing and cancellation of a semester?
